event.title: had lived there for around 19,500 years

data.event: Based on archaeological excavations in the Mount Moffatt area, it has been deduced that the Aboriginals had lived there for around 19,500 years.
Descendants of the original peoples still live in and visit the area today.
The town is named after Sir Thomas Mitchell explorer and Surveyor General of New South Wales, who explored the area in 1846.
In 1854, Edmund Morey established the property of Mitchell Downs.

event.title: was largely destroyed by a flood in 1864

data.event: When the original homestead was largely destroyed by a flood in 1864, Thomas Close acquired the building's ruins established the Maranoa Hotel.

event.title: 1 January 1865, Mitchell Downs Post Office opened

data.event: On 1 January 1865, Mitchell Downs Post Office opened and around 1878 was renamed Mitchell Post Office.
On 1 January 1865, Mitchell Downs Post Office opened and around 1878 was renamed Mitchell Post Office.
